oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Collapsed fireman carried to safety, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo, published in the Nashville Times (1940), about “three city firemen who were overcome while fighting a $75,000 blaze which damaged Everett Beasley Dry Goods Company at 304-306 Broad Street Monday afternoon. The fire started during the severe storm, apparently the result of lightning. The three injured firemen were treated at General Hospital.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Everett Beasley Dry Goods (Nashville, Tenn.)
